titleStmt.title: The storming of the Anabaptists garrisons, vvith a brief discovery of the weaknesse of the same, & of the inconsiderableness of the sconces and forts of all the other sectaries, in despight and contempt of all the which, any Christian souldier may safely march to Heaven, without the least danger; ... In a word, in the insuing discourse, the vanity of all novell opinions is discovered, the ignorance of all the which can no way hinder any mans happinesse: and the baptisme of little children borne of Christian parents, whether Iewes or Gentiles, is proved by the word of God to be lawfull, ... / By Iohn Bastwick, Doctor in Physick.
titleStmt.author: Bastwick, John, 1593-1654.
Smart, Richard, fl. 1647.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.W. for Joshua Kirton, and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the white Horse in Pauls Church-yard.,

notesStmt.note: Bastwick's treatise is framed as a reply to a letter from Richard Smart, which is included (pages 1-4).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
